thread.title: 2 Indian men accused of conspiring to smuggle people into US
thread.title_full: 2 Indian men accused of conspiring to smuggle people into US | News24

author: news24.com
title: 2 Indian men accused of conspiring to smuggle people into US
text:
Newark - Two Indian nationals conspired with an undercover federal agent to smuggle people from Thailand to New Jersey, prosecutors said on Thursday.
Nileshkumar Patel and Harsad Mehta were arrested on Wednesday at Newark Liberty International Airport and were remanded into custody after a brief appearance before a judge on Thursday on smuggling and conspiracy charges. Messages left seeking comment from attorneys for the men weren't immediately returned.
Patel and Mehta met with an undercover Homeland Security Investigations agent on multiple occasions in Bangkok starting in April 2014 and paid the agent $35 000 to $50 000 to have six Indians smuggled into New Jersey even though they didn't have legal clearance to come to America, Special Agent Douglas Doherty said in a criminal complaint.
Patel was involved in all six cases, and Mehta in four, prosecutors said.
